description: President Donald Trump said negotiators made “big progress” after a meeting with a Japanese delegation on Wednesday aimed at securing a deal that would avoid higher levies he has threatened against US trading partners.
title: Trump Says ‘Big Progress’ After Talks With Japan on Tariff Deal

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior economy reporter Enda Curran looks at what the Federal Reserve chair had to say about tariffs and the economy. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Powell Stays in Wait-and-See Mode on Impact of Tariffs

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom said he’ll have to cut the state’s baseline spending to balance next fiscal year’s budget because new federal trade policies under President Donald Trump have dampened California’s economic outlook.
title: Newsom to Cut California Budget As Trump’s Trade War Crimps Economic Outlook

description: Ballooning property prices and rents are causing serious housing affordability problems in Australia. So how bad is it? And how did it get to this point?
title: How Australia’s Housing Market Became So Out Of Reach

description: The Israel Defense Forces said it is preparing to expand the area of its ground attacks in the Gaza Strip, seeking to tighten its grip on the war-ravaged enclave as hope for a new truce keeps fading.
title: Israel to Expand Ground Operation, Take Over New Swathes of Gaza

description: Republican US Representative Elise Stefanik is weighing a run for New York governor in 2026, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: GOP’s Elise Stefanik Said to Weigh Run for New York Governor

description: The Trump administration is fast-tracking a permit needed by Enbridge Inc. to build a disputed pipeline tunnel under the Straits of Mackinac in northern Michigan.
title: Enbridge’s Pipeline Tunnel in Michigan Gets Expedited by US

description: Peru is notorious for jailing, prosecuting and sentencing more former presidents than almost any nation in the world. But their spouses are a different story.
title: Peru Excels at Jailing Ex-Presidents. Their Spouses, Not So Much

description: The Trump administration is preparing to pressure nations to curb trade with China in negotiations over US tariffs, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Looks to Box In China by Recruiting Other Trading Partners

description: The mood at the New York Republicans’ annual fundraiser in Manhattan was subdued compared with their inauguration weekend event in Washington, though the evening had its moments of fire.
title: Trump's Harvard Fight Draws Applause at New York Republicans’ Annual Fundraiser

description: Ontario will make trading with other Canadian provinces easier, hoping to mitigate damage from the country’s ongoing trade war with the US.
title: Tariff Fight Prompts Ontario to Tear Down Provincial Trade Barriers

description: President Donald Trump ousted two Democratic members of the National Credit Union Administration Board, adding to a spate of recent firings as he continues to assert more control over independent agencies.
title: Trump Fires NCUA Board Members, Tightening Grip on Agencies

description: A federal judge said there is sufficient evidence to hold the Trump administration in criminal contempt of court for sending accused Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador prison last month despite his order to immediately halt the deportations.
title: Judge Enters Contempt Order in Venezuelan Deportations Case

description: Mark Zuckerberg said that ByteDance Ltd.’s TikTok posed a “highly urgent” competitive threat to Meta Platforms Inc. when it first sprang up in 2018, as he testified for a third day in the Federal Trade Commission’s antitrust trial.
title: Meta Saw TikTok as ‘Highly Urgent’ Threat, Zuckerberg Says at Antitrust Trial

description: Slovakia tightened rules on nongovernmental organizations in a move that critics say may stifle dissent in the European Union member state.
title: Slovakia Tightens Rules on NGOs Premier Sees as Unfriendly

description: On this episode of Trumponomics, economist Nouriel Roubini explains the various tools Beijing has to absorb economic blows—and strike back.
title: How China Can Weather Trump’s Trade War

description: The UK is seeking a migration agreement with the European Union, which would allow it to broker separate deals with individual member states on the return of some migrants.
title: UK Seeks EU Go-Ahead to Broker Migrant Returns With Members

description: Serbian lawmakers approved a political novice as premier on Wednesday, in a government reboot that aims to tame unrelenting street protests against the establishment dominated by President Aleksandar Vucic.
title: Serbia Approves New Premier in Bid to Tame Unrelenting Protests

description: Kenya is seeking realistic targets in a new program with the International Monetary Fund, according to a top government official, following deadly protests over taxes and US President Donald Trump’s trade levies.
title: Kenya Seeks Realistic IMF Deal After Tax Protests, Trump Tariffs

description: Former Harvard University President Larry Summers assailed President Donald Trump over his deepening attacks on the school, slamming a “wildly extralegal” federal funding freeze earlier this week.
title: Summers Slams Trump’s ‘Wildly Extralegal’ Attacks on Harvard

description: South Africa’s Democratic Alliance laid corruption charges against Human Settlements Minister Thembisile Simelane, alleging that she defrauded state power utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd.
title: South Africa’s DA Lays Corruption Charges Against Minister

description: Fighting in South Sudan has left more than 180 people dead and forced 125,000 others to flee their homes since March, the United Nations said, reiterating an appeal for the urgent protection of civilians in the East African nation.
title: Renewed Fighting in South Sudan Leaves 180 People Dead, UN Says

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana sees no alternative to a tax increase at the heart of a budget impasse that is threatening to unravel the country’s governing coalition.
title: South Africa’s Godongwana Sees No Alternative to VAT Increase

description: Kenya is seeking private investors to develop high-voltage transmission lines months after it canceled a deal with India’s Adani Group.
title: Kenya Seeks Bids for $245 Million Power Lines After Adani Exit

description: US Vice President JD Vance will embark Thursday on a week-long trip to Italy and India, according to the White House, visiting two nations whose leaders are eager to strike trade agreements with the Trump administration.
title: Vance, Second Lady to Visit India and Italy on Weeklong Trip

description: Worry grips Windsor, Ontario, as the city’s massive Stellantis plant temporarily shuts its doors.
title: Canadian Auto Town Gets an Early Taste of Trump’s Trade War

description: The World Trade Organization slashed its forecast for merchandise trade this year as soaring US tariffs and broader uncertainty hammer international commerce.
title: WTO Slashes Outlook for Global Trade on Trump Tariff Disruptions

description: Poland’s top utility executives are heeding Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s call for state power companies to provide cheap electricity as the country seeks to stay competitive amid the tectonic changes in global trade.
title: Tusk’s ‘Poland First’ Call Has Utility CEOs Coveting Cheap Power

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico rebuked the European Union’s top diplomat for urging leaders to drop their plans to visit Moscow for celebrations marking the Soviet Union’s 80th anniversary of victory in World War II.
title: Slovak Premier Slams EU’s Kallas for Call to Cancel Moscow Trip

description: President Donald Trump’s border czar, Tom Homan, said federal agents are going to pour into sanctuary cities and increase enforcement operations at places of employment as the administration looks to ramp up its deportation push.
title: Trump Border Czar Plans to ‘Flood’ Worksites in Deportation Push

description: The US Justice Department said it will file a lawsuit against Maine over a state anti-discrimination law that allows transgender athletes to participate in girls’ and women’s sports.
title: DOJ to Sue Maine Over Trans Women Competing in Female Sports

description: Yemeni forces opposed to the Houthis are in talks with the US and Gulf Arab allies about a possible land offensive to oust the militant group from the Red Sea coast, according to people involved in the discussions.
title: US in Talks With Yemeni Forces on Land Offensive Against Houthis

description: Thai security services are doxxing pro-democracy activists on Facebook and X, urging their followers to harass them in a campaign of intimidation, cybersecurity researchers said.
title: Thai Security Services Doxxing Activists, Watchdog Says

description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said he trusts US President Donald Trump despite recent surveys showing growing disapproval of the American leader in Australia just weeks before the May 3 election.
title: Australia’s PM Says He Trusts Donald Trump in Second Debate

description: California Governor Gavin Newsom said his state is suing to halt President Donald Trump’s tariffs, citing harm to consumers and businesses in the world’s fifth-largest economy.
title: California’s Newsom Says State to Sue Over Trump’s Tariffs

description: María Corina Machado says the opposition she’s leading is targeting Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro’s two biggest vulnerabilities: a rapidly worsening economy and fractures within his own repression machine.
title: Plotting in the Shadows, Machado Takes Aim at Maduro’s Weakness

description: Harvard University’s decision to stand up to President Donald Trump sparked cheers from politicians across Massachusetts, but the resulting federal funding cuts risk imperiling the region’s primary economic engine.
title: Harvard’s $9 Billion Battle With Trump Is Bad News for Massachusetts’ Economy

description: US President Donald Trump said he’ll attend a meeting Wednesday with Japan to negotiate tariffs, American military support and “trade fairness.”
title: Trump to Join Japan Talks Today on Tariffs, Military Support

description: UK government officials have raised private concerns that Chinese-manufactured drones are being used to take high resolution images of critical national infrastructure sites in the UK, going against guidance from the country’s security services.
title: UK Raises Alarm on Chinese Drones Used to Survey Sensitive Sites

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s approval and trust ratings tumbled by double digits last month, according to a survey conducted more than a week after ex-leader Rodrigo Duterte’s arrest.
title: Philippine President Marcos’ Ratings Slide After Duterte Arrest

description: Russia has asked the US to let it buy Boeing Co. aircraft using money from billions of dollars in frozen state assets once there’s a ceasefire in Ukraine, according to a person in Moscow familiar with the matter.
title: Russia Asks to Buy Boeing Jets With Frozen Assets in US Talks

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: An Unusually Interesting Election in Singapore

description: The terms "woman" and "sex" in the Equality Act refer to a biological woman and biological sex, the Supreme Court has ruled.
title: 'Woman' in Equality Law Refers to Biological Women, UK Supreme Court Rules

description: Support for the African National Congress, which ruled South Africa outright for three decades after apartheid rule ended, has slipped further since it lost its parliamentary majority in last year’s elections and now lags that of its main rival for the first time, a new opinion poll showed.
title: South Africa’s ANC Lags Main Rival in New Voter Opinion Poll

description: Iran said it won’t be drawn into negotiations over its ability to enrich uranium in nuclear talks with the US, a sign that the tentative diplomatic push to resolve their standoff over Tehran’s atomic work may have already hit a major snag.
title: Iran Says Ability to Enrich Uranium Is Not Up for Negotiation

description: China wants to see a number of steps from President Donald Trump’s administration before it will agree to trade talks, including showing more respect by reining in disparaging remarks by members of his cabinet, according to a person familiar with the Chinese government’s thinking.
title: China Open to Talks If US Shows Respect, Names Point Person

description: Singapore’s prime minister said he sees America’s inward turn opening up a void in international affairs that will leave the world “more fragmented and disorderly,” with China and other big powers unable to fill the gap.
title: Singapore PM Warns of ‘Messy Transition’ as US Steps Back

description: India’s federal investigative agency has filed charges of money laundering against senior leaders of the main opposition party Indian National Congress, ramping up the government’s crackdown on political rivals.
title: Indian Agency Charges Gandhi Family with Money Laundering

description: Georgetown University is renewing its contract for its foreign services school in Qatar by a decade, extending an overseas partnership at a time when the Trump administration has frozen federal funding to other US colleges.
title: Georgetown Extends Qatar Contract Amid Trump Fight With Colleges

description: President Xi Jinping said he encourages Chinese companies to invest and start businesses in Malaysia, as part of his push to deepen ties in Southeast Asia to counter mounting pressure from the US.
title: Xi Promotes Chinese Investment in Malaysia on Trip to Boost Ties

description: Australian Communications Minister Michelle Rowland gave a personal guarantee to the global head of YouTube that the platform would be exempt from the country’s social-media ban for under-16s, even before an official consultation process on the special carveout, according to documents obtained under freedom-of-information laws.
title: YouTube Was Guaranteed Exemption From Australia Social Media Ban

description: From fighter planes to nuclear reactor rods and smartphones, rare earth minerals are vital to a wide array of products. As geopolitical and trade tensions rise, China’s dominance of both mining and processing means these niche metals have become a cudgel to use against opponents.
title: Seven Rare Earth Metals That China Is Weaponizing Against the US

description: China replaced its trade representative as Beijing and Washington remain at an impasse over the conditions for talks to cool the escalating trade war.
title: China Names New Trade Envoy as Tariff War With US Escalates

description: The US appears to have tempered its demands for the payback of aid by Ukraine during talks over an economic deal between the two nations, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Softens Calls for Ukraine to Pay Back Aid in Minerals Deal Talks

description: Americans are scouring Chinese e-commerce apps for cheap handbags, yoga pants and wallets as shoppers fear homegrown platforms will hike prices due to tariffs.
title: American Shoppers Flock to Chinese Apps on Tariff Fears

description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni spent months working toward this moment: Her very own meeting with Donald Trump at the White House.
title: Meloni Faces Trump Litmus Test After Months of Preparation

description: Indonesia has raised the royalty rate to be paid by nickel, tin and other metal producers as the government searches for ways to fund President Prabowo Subianto’s ambitious but costly priority policies.
title: Indonesia Hikes Mining Royalties to Fund Prabowo Policies

description: When the US and Japan open trade talks on Wednesday, the world will be closely watching Ryosei Akazawa to provide a glimpse of what a deal with President Donald Trump might look like.
title: Novice Japan Negotiator Seeks to Strike First Deal With Trump

description: Hong Kong will stop official postal services for goods to the US, as the city follows Beijing in hitting back at Donald Trump in a trade war that increasingly sweeps up the Asian financial hub.
title: Hong Kong Postal Service Halts US Parcels on Tariff ‘Bullying’
